body: Hmmm this could be an issue with EnumCoercion not recognizing StrEnum. As a workaround please follow the guidelines here and move your enums into a separate module: https://docs.streamlit.io/develop/concepts/design/custom-classes
Actually I take that back, doesn't even appear to be reaching the enum coercion spot in the code. What happens if you try `list(ModelStr)` as your options value instead?
This works, am curious as in Why vanilla Enum worked without list? ðŸ¤”

> This works, am curious as in Why vanilla Enum worked without list? ðŸ¤”

Great question. I suspect it's because the line is returning the enum itself, incorrectly assuming the enum is position-indexable when it is in fact not (the class inherits from "str" which has an "index" method). Turning it into a list first makes it position-indexable
https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/blob/e3a1588a560ce8061a0e0bebdd8cb183c462470d/lib/streamlit/elements/widgets/selectbox.py#L237

I would classify this as a bug with "ensure_indexible". Thanks for reporting!
Yes, I would like to contribute and send a patch PR!
Hey @97k were you still interested in contributing a patch for this?

Yes! I am interested @Asaurus1 . This is now on my top priority list.
I will send a patch soon.

> > This works, am curious as in Why vanilla Enum worked without list? ðŸ¤”
> 
> Great question. I suspect it's because the line is returning the enum itself, incorrectly assuming the enum is position-indexable when it is in fact not (the class inherits from "str" which has an "index" method). Turning it into a list first makes it position-indexable
> 
> https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/blob/e3a1588a560ce8061a0e0bebdd8cb183c462470d/lib/streamlit/elements/widgets/selectbox.py#L237
> 
> I would classify this as a bug with "ensure_indexible". Thanks for reporting!

@Asaurus1 
This is exactly what is happening, the issue is with 'index' method in str and because of this, it is stepping inside the if block and index of string is returned.

A hardcoded, type check on Enum would fix it

`if callable(index_fn) and type(it) != EnumType`

this block of code will fix issues with Enum and will not break anything else.

I will create a PR, we can have discussions on it if you want.

issue.title: fix: #8500 bypass StrEnum 'index' to make position-indexable

repository.name: streamlit

Patch to ensure StrEnum doesn't get messed up because of str `index`
